channel.title: Code Too Large Error
channel.description:
So after adding in some additional things to my client class in my Delta server, i received the code too large error. My parseIncomingPackets void has become to large. I understand why this happens and I have heard that in order to fix it I just need to split the code into two parts. But wherever I attempt to split up the code, i always get errors such as illegal start of expression, orphaned cases, and some others.
My question is, is there a specific spot I should break up the code? I'm guessing that this same error has happened to a few people (at least I've heard it's common) so if I could get a little help on how to fix it I would much appreciate it :)

item.title: Code Too Large Error
item.dc:creator: @Carnifex12 Carnifex12
item.description:
@Carnifex12 wrote:

I finally fixed it guys! thanks for your help!

Read full topic

item.title: Code Too Large Error
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

What you could do is take the packets that have the highest amount of code and separate them. Or you can do what most servers do today and use either an array or hash map to hold the packet data then use abstract class that all the packets can extend.

Read full topic

item.title: Code Too Large Error
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Has the method become to large or the class? Could you post a picture/copy what the compiler says.

Read full topic

item.title: Code Too Large Error
item.dc:creator: @Carnifex12 Carnifex12
item.description:
@Carnifex12 wrote:

Yes I understand there is a limit (already explained this) the problem is I can’t figure out what parts to put in each separate void/class. Wherever I choose to cut it off always creates more errors

Read full topic

item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

lol there’s a limit to how long a function can be simply extend some of the code into a separate function
